snippet: In Washington, where President Obama and the Republican-controlled House are apt to clash, big bipartisan legislative dreams seem all but certain to be miniaturized as incremental policy visions.
abstract: News analysis; nation's fiscal crisis has made one thing crystal clear: era of grand bargains remains elusive holy grail of fiscal policy and seems destined to stay that way for now; despite intense efforts by Pres Obama, House Speaker John A Boehner and bipartisan coalitions, emerging patchwork tax deal will push series of fights into next Congress.
lead_paragraph: In Washington, where President Obama and the Republican-controlled House are apt to clash, big bipartisan legislative dreams seem all but certain to be miniaturized as incremental policy visions.

headline.seo: Grand Bargains Give Way to Legislative Quick Fixes
headline.main: Grand Deals Give Way to Legislative Quick Fixes
